meanings.sent1: She stosses the door open when she's in a hurry.
meanings.sent2: He stossed the heavy box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy stosses the ball around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The determined climber stosses up the steep mountain.
meanings.sent5: With a loud grunt, he stosses the stubborn rock out of the way.

meanings.definition: A sudden, forceful movement or impact
meanings.sent1: The earthquake caused a powerful stoss that shook the entire building.
meanings.sent2: The car accident resulted in a strong stoss to the rear bumper.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected stoss of the ball startled the players on the field.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm brought a series of stosses that rattled the windows.
meanings.sent5: The boxer delivered a knockout punch with a swift stoss.

meanings.definition: In a direction opposite to the usual one
meanings.sent1: She turned stoss to avoid the crowded street.
meanings.sent2: The river flows stoss from north to south in this region.
meanings.sent3: The cat walked stoss to the usual path, exploring a new route.
